intro: Bossiaea rhombifolia var. concolor, commonly known as the smooth bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, green, rhomboid-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in heathlands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
